title: Obstructing Left-Sided Colon Cancer
diagnosis_topic: Descending colon adenocarcinoma causing large bowel obstruction
setup_script: A 68-year-old man presents with abdominal distension, obstipation, and vomiting for two days. He has a history of weight loss and iron-deficiency anemia. CT abdomen shows an obstructing mass in the descending colon with proximal dilation and no signs of perforation.

dynamic_flow.trigger: Take history focusing on change in bowel habits, weight loss, family history, and constitutional symptoms.
Perform physical exam noting abdominal distension, tympany, and signs of peritonitis; assess hemodynamic stability.
Order labs including CBC, CMP, coagulation studies, and carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) level.
Obtain CT scan confirming left-sided obstructing mass without perforation; discuss differential of benign vs malignant obstruction.
Place nasogastric tube for decompression; start IV fluids and broad-spectrum antibiotics.
Consult gastroenterology for colonoscopy to obtain biopsy and decompress using stent if patient is high risk or bridge to surgery.
Discuss surgical options: emergent Hartmann's procedure versus on-table primary anastomosis after onco-surgical resection; consider patient's nutrition and comorbidities.
Decide to proceed with left hemicolectomy with primary anastomosis if stable and bowel preparation feasible.
Perform oncologic resection with high vascular ligation and regional lymphadenectomy; evaluate anastomotic viability.
Postoperative management: monitor for anastomotic leak, ileus, and treat pain; start early ambulation and DVT prophylaxis.
Review pathology staging; refer to oncology for adjuvant therapy based on TNM stage.
Plan surveillance colonoscopy and CEA monitoring; counsel patient on lifestyle modification and family screening.

critical_decision_points: Recognition and stabilization of acute large bowel obstruction.
Decision on stent placement versus emergency resection and anastomosis.
Proper oncologic resection with lymphadenectomy and margin assessment.
Postoperative monitoring for anastomotic leak and management of complications.
Coordination with oncology for adjuvant therapy and surveillance.
